title: Five for your planner
text:
Roxann Miller Five for your planner 
Riley Grimes, her sister Avery and brother Justin of Montgomery Village, Md., stir a pot of apple butter Saturday at the 38th annual Apple Butter Festival in Berkeley Springs, W.Va. Posted: Tuesday, October 6, 2015 7:00 am Five for your planner 
Apple Butter Festival, 10:30 a.m. 5 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 10; noon to 5 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 11. Downtown Berkeley Springs, W.Va. Free trolley ride from parking at U.S. Silica to the Ice House and back during festival hours both days; parade at 9 a.m. Saturday; apple butter making in the square and Environmental Row, both days; Mike Colyer and the Tonehounds perform from 11:30 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. and 12:45 to 1:30 p.m. Saturday; Rumours, 2 to 4 p.m. Saturday ; Marv Ashby and High Octane perform from 1 to 2 p.m. and 2:45 to 4 p.m. Sunday. Go to www.berkeleysprings.com/apple-butter-festival or www.berkeleysprings.com/schedule . 
“Edge of Appalachia,” reception from 4 to 8 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9. Engine Room Art Space, 36 N. Potomac St., downtown Hagerstown. Hours are 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Thursday and Friday; 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturday; 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sunday. The exhibit features three artists from different areas of the region called Appalachia. Call 240-520-1407 or email ejones@hagerstownmd.org . Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety. You need an online service to view this article in its entirety. Have an online subscription?
